result.execSummary:
The defendant Mark A. Mayo was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Capture an Image of Nudity, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 942.09(2)(am)1.
  • Capture an Image of Nudity, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 942.09(2)(am)1.
  • Capture an Image of Nudity, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 942.09(2)(am)1.

  • Capture an Image of Nudity, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 942.09(2)(am)1.
  • Capture an Image of Nudity, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 942.09(2)(am)1.
  • Capture an Image of Nudity, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 942.09(2)(am)1.
  • Capture an Image of Nudity, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 942.09(2)(am)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: The Defendant is to undergo any counseling the agent finds appropriate and must comply with any recommended treatment/assessment/counseling.  Defendant may not withdraw from any ordered program without permission of the agent and/or provider. Defendant to undergo sex offender assessment and follow through with any recommendations.  The Defendant is to obtain and maintain full time employment and/or educational programming as recommended. Defendant is to have no contact with any victim. Defendant is to have no contact with J.C. without prior approval of Agent. Defendant is to have no contact with victim-granddaughter- without prior approval of Agent.  The Defendant is to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis, unless already provided. Defendant to have no access to internet without prior approval of Agent. Defendant is not to possess any recording device without prior approval of Agent, including cell phone, video recorder or any other electronic device. Defendant to comply with sex offender registry during confinement, extended supervision, probation and 15 years following supervision discharge. Defendant to maintain a stable residence.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
